name: nvram-binary-operations
description: The /usr/sbin/nvram binary contains various NVRAM operations including getting, setting, deleting, and committing NVRAM variables. The program processes different NVRAM operation requests through command-line parameters.
notes:
nvram_get/nvram_set

Although NVRAM operations were detected, specific variable names and potential security risks have not yet been identified. Further analysis of other binary files is required.

name: httpd-nvram-operations
code_snippet:
bl sym.imp.nvram_set (HIDDENddns_REDACTED_PASSWORD_PLACEHOLDER)
bl sym.imp.nvram_set (HIDDENddns_passwd)
bl sym.imp.nvram_set (HIDDENddns_wildcard)
notes: Passwords are stored in plaintext; if NVRAM data is leaked, credentials may be compromised. It is recommended to check whether these values are used for sensitive operations.
